sentences.sContent: They have a beautiful home in California.
sentences.sCn: 他们在加州有个美丽的家。

sentences.sContent: Good luck in your new home!
A family of birds made their home (= started living ) under the roof.
sentences.sCn: 一窝鸟在屋顶下安了家。

sentences.sContent: These children need a proper home life.
sentences.sCn: 这些孩子需要正常的家庭生活。

sentences.sContent: ...he came home from school almost in tears...
...So it might be a good idea to get someone else to drive you home after that marathon...
...I was a student – or sitting around at home very much...
...Being overworked or over-committed at home and on the job will not get you where you want to be in life...
...as opposed to using my free time at home to work on a test...
...A person who bad input into where he would move and has had time to adapt to it might do as well in a nursing home as in a small residential care home...
...Let’s put this person in a residential care home instead of a nursing home—she will be much better off...
...your family are friendly and make me feel at home when every time I visit you...
...A friend recently took her mother to visit an expensive assisted living/nursing home near my town...
...Many people feel guilty when they cannot find a place other than a nursing home for their parents...

synos.tran: 家，住宅；产地；家乡；避难所

phrases.pCn: 在家中般轻松自在；感觉自在

words.tran: 家庭的；平凡的；不好看的
回家的；自动导引的；有返回性的
舒适的；家庭似的；自在的
舒适的，自在的；如在家的
喜欢在家消遣的男人；家庭第一主义的男人

trans.tranOther: the house, apartment, or place where you live
relating to or belonging to your home or family
